page.title: 07Local ceramics industry
page.content: A number of firms in this area are involved in the ceramics industry, owing to the ready availability of raw materials. Hepworths have a major pipe works as do Naylor Brothers. The latter was established in 1840 as a civil engineering company which in 1877 built a stone viaduct in Denby Dale replacing a wooden one. During the excavations for this project, the discovery of deposits of high quality fire clay and shale, combined with the convenience of nearby coal to fire the kilns (this process recently changed to use liquefied natural gas), led to the current specialisation in ceramics. Naylors employ about 450 and a 3/4 million pound investment plan for a new kiln will create 33 new jobs. Naylors produce about 10% of UK's industrial clay pipes, and export about 10% of their total production.
